response.original_title: Dipingere l'anima del XX secolo: Pellizza Da Volpedo
response.overview: Tells the story of the tormented life of divisionist painter Giuseppe Pellizza (1868-1907), famous for his work The Fourth Estate – shown to the public for the first time at the 1902 Turin Quadriennale and housed today at the Galleria d’Arte Moderna (Modern Art Gallery) in Milan – as well as for his ability to study the soul and  human society.
response.title: Painting the Soul of the 20th Century: Pellizza Da Volpedo
